description: Returns metadata about all versions of the objects in a bucket. You can also use request parameters as selection criteria to return metadata about a subset of all the object versions. To use this operation, you must have READ access to the bucket. The following operations are related to ListObjectVersions:

parameters.name: Bucket
parameters.description: The bucket name that contains the objects.

parameters.name: Delimiter
parameters.description: A delimiter is a character that you specify to group keys. All keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter are grouped under a single result element in CommonPrefixes. These groups are counted as one result against the max-keys limitation. These keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. CommonPrefixes is filtered out from results if it is not lexicographically greater than the key-marker.

parameters.name: EncodingType
parameters.description: Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response. Responses are encoded only in UTF-8. An object key can contain any Unicode character. However, the XML 1.0 parser can't parse certain characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that aren't supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response. For more information about characters to avoid in object key names, see Object key naming guidelines.

parameters.name: RequestPayer
parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that they will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. If either the source or destination S3 bucket has Requester Pays enabled, the requester will pay for corresponding charges to copy the object. For information about downloading objects from Requester Pays buckets, see Downloading Objects in Requester Pays Buckets in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

parameters.name: OptionalObjectAttributes
parameters.description: Specifies the optional fields that you want returned in the response. Fields that you do not specify are not returned. (string) ---

nested_items.name: IsTruncated
nested_items.description: A flag that indicates whether Amazon S3 returned all of the results that satisfied the search criteria. If your results were truncated, you can make a follow-up paginated request by using the NextKeyMarker and NextVersionIdMarker response parameters as a starting place in another request to return the rest of the results.

nested_items.name: KeyMarker
nested_items.description: Marks the last key returned in a truncated response.

nested_items.name: VersionIdMarker
nested_items.description: Marks the last version of the key returned in a truncated response.

nested_items.name: NextKeyMarker
nested_items.description: When the number of responses exceeds the value of MaxKeys, NextKeyMarker specifies the first key not returned that satisfies the search criteria. Use this value for the key-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: NextVersionIdMarker
nested_items.description: When the number of responses exceeds the value of MaxKeys, NextVersionIdMarker specifies the first object version not returned that satisfies the search criteria. Use this value for the version-id-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: Versions
nested_items.description: Container for version information.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The entity tag is an MD5 hash of that version of the object.

nested_items.name: ChecksumAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm that was used to create a checksum of the object.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ChecksumType
nested_items.description: The checksum type that is used to calculate the object's checksum value. For more information, see Checking object integrity in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Size
nested_items.description: Size in bytes of the object.

nested_items.name: StorageClass
nested_items.description: The class of storage used to store the object.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The object key.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: Version ID of an object.

nested_items.name: IsLatest
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest version of an object.

nested_items.name: LastModified
nested_items.description: Date and time when the object was last modified.

nested_items.name: DisplayName
nested_items.description: Container for the display name of the owner. This value is only supported in the following Amazon Web Services Regions:
US East (N. Virginia)
US West (N. California)
US West (Oregon)
Asia Pacific (Singapore)
Asia Pacific (Sydney)
Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
South America (SÃ£o Paulo)

nested_items.name: ID
nested_items.description: Container for the ID of the owner.

nested_items.name: RestoreStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the restoration status of an object. Objects in certain storage classes must be restored before they can be retrieved. For more information about these storage classes and how to work with archived objects, see Working with archived objects in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: IsRestoreInProgress
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the object is currently being restored. If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value TRUE. For example:

nested_items.name: RestoreExpiryDate
nested_items.description: Indicates when the restored copy will expire. This value is populated only if the object has already been restored. For example:

nested_items.name: DeleteMarkers
nested_items.description: Container for an object that is a delete marker. To learn more about delete markers, see Working with delete markers.

nested_items.name: DisplayName
nested_items.description: Container for the display name of the owner. This value is only supported in the following Amazon Web Services Regions:
US East (N. Virginia)
US West (N. California)
US West (Oregon)
Asia Pacific (Singapore)
Asia Pacific (Sydney)
Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
South America (SÃ£o Paulo)

nested_items.name: ID
nested_items.description: Container for the ID of the owner.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The object key.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: Version ID of an object.

nested_items.name: IsLatest
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest version of an object.

nested_items.name: LastModified
nested_items.description: Date and time when the object was last modified.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The bucket name.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: Selects objects that start with the value supplied by this parameter.

nested_items.name: Delimiter
nested_items.description: The delimiter grouping the included keys. A delimiter is a character that you specify to group keys. All keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter are grouped under a single result element in CommonPrefixes. These groups are counted as one result against the max-keys limitation. These keys are not returned elsewhere in the response.

nested_items.name: MaxKeys
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to return.

nested_items.name: CommonPrefixes
nested_items.description: All of the keys rolled up into a common prefix count as a single return when calculating the number of returns.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: Container for the specified common prefix.

nested_items.name: EncodingType
nested_items.description: Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML response.

nested_items.name: RequestCharged
nested_items.description: If present, indicates that the requester was successfully charged for the request. For more information, see Using Requester Pays buckets for storage transfers and usage in the Amazon Simple Storage Service user guide.
